info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun and southeastern Macon Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Clayton, or near Sky Valley, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Mountain City, Dillard, Sky Valley, Highlands, Scaly Mountain and Pine Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
